dd613335-71d3-476b-b1d1-5a825aaeba2f.name: Joe's Filter for Persnickety Players (updated: 3/10/2025)
dd613335-71d3-476b-b1d1-5a825aaeba2f.description: A collection of loot filters for OSRS

modules.name: Global defaults
modules.subtitle: The first layer of styling and filtering
modules.description: This provides some default styling options to apply to all items, unless overridden by a module below. This also provides an option to explicitly show and hide specific items. This list however can be overridden in a below module as well.

modules.name: Item tiers
modules.subtitle: Pick out the good stuff
modules.description: This highlights items based on their values. By default tiers are 20k, 100k, 1m, and 10m, with loot beams appearing starting at 1m.

modules.name: Uniques
modules.subtitle: Uniques are special! (even if they're not worth a lot)
modules.description: Add custom effect to unique items. By default this gives uniques on this list a loot beam. This can layer with other styling such as item tiers.

inputs.label: List of uniques to apply custom unique style to (by default just lootbeam)

modules.name: Currency
modules.subtitle: Money makes the world go 'round
modules.description: This module provides styling and quantity filters for all currencies in the game.

modules.name: Clue Scrolls
modules.subtitle: Can you do me one small favor?
modules.description: This module provides clue tier filters and custom styling for each clue tier.

modules.name: Remains
modules.subtitle: Don't open dead inside
modules.description: For filtering out bones, ensouled heads, ashes, and shades of morton remains

inputs.label: Minimum value to display remains at
Shades of morton remains to hide

modules.name: Chambers of Xeric
modules.subtitle: The twisted bow awaits...
modules.description: This provides per-item filters and custom styling for all drops that happen during your chambers of xeric raid. By default this styles each drop uniquely so they are easier to pick off the ground.

modules.name: Runes
modules.subtitle: The magic things, not the armor
modules.description: Quantity thresholds, filters, and custom styling for runes.

modules.name: Logs
modules.subtitle: Chop chop!
modules.description: Provides quantity filters, log type filters, and custom styling for all logs. By default this colors all logs similar to their item color.

modules.name: Fishing
modules.subtitle: Filters for fishing equipment and raw fish
modules.description: This module provides filters for fishing equipment, fishing bait, and raw fish

modules.name: Ores
modules.subtitle: The children yearn for the mines
modules.description: Quantity thresholds, filters, and custom styling for all ores. By default colors them based on the item color.

modules.name: Gems
modules.subtitle: Shilo village provides
modules.description: This module provides quantity filtering, tier filtering, and styling for all gem tiers. By default this styles gems to closely match their in-game colors.

modules.name: Bars
modules.subtitle: The thing between ores and armours
modules.description: This module provides bar tier filters, quantity filters, and custom styling for all bars.

inputs.label: Bronze bar minimum quantity to show
Iron bar minimum quantity to show
Silver bar minimum quantity to show
Steel bar minimum quantity to show
Gold bar minimum quantity to show
Mithril bar minimum quantity to show
Adamantite bar minimum quantity to show
Runite bar minimum quantity to show
Elemental metal minimum quantity to show
Primed bar minimum quantity to show
Primed mind bar minimum quantity to show
Blurite bar minimum quantity to show
Enchanted bar minimum quantity to show
Lovakite bar minimum quantity to show
'Perfect' gold bar minimum quantity to show

modules.name: Herbs
modules.subtitle: Kaqemeex would be proud
modules.description: Provides herb filters, quantity filters per herb, and custom styling for each herb. By default, this gives each herb unique styling.

modules.name: Farming seeds
modules.subtitle: The stuff from the master farmers' pockets
modules.description: Provides specific seed filters and value threshold for filtering out seeds from being shown. The default is to hide lower tier seeds.

inputs.label: Minimum value to display secondaries at

modules.name: Herblore secondaries
modules.subtitle: Eyes, eggs, and everything in-between
modules.description: Provides some basic filtering for herblore secondaries.

inputs.label: Minimum value to display secondaries at

modules.name: Potions
modules.subtitle: Drink up!
modules.description: Filters and styling for potions. By default this filters out lower tier potions and gives every potion unique styling.

modules.name: Barbarian Potions
modules.subtitle: People use these?
modules.description: This module provides per-item filtering and custom styling for all barbarian potions. By default ALL barbarian potions are filtered out. LOL

inputs.label: Extended super antifire mix custom style

modules.name: Food
modules.subtitle: The stuff you eat
modules.description: This module provides filters based on food groups with some sane defaults. It also provides styling options available for every food group that has a filter. This can be done at the group level or on a food-by-food basis. A few popular foods have been given custom styling out of the box.

modules.name: Metal Equipment
modules.subtitle: Watch out for lightning
modules.description: Provides a metal tier filter and custom styling for metal equipment including trimmed, gold trimmed, gilded, heraldic, and god rune armours.

modules.name: Barrows
modules.subtitle: 6 brothers united in death
modules.description: This module provides custom styling for barrows equipment on the ground. You likely won't see this unless you're pking. And even then you probably won't see it because loot keys are a thing.

modules.name: Gauntlet
modules.subtitle: Crystal palace of suffering
modules.description: Filtering and style for the Gauntlet

modules.name: Rare drop table
modules.subtitle: Give RDT some special attention
modules.description: Give RDT drops unique styling. This gives RDT drops a gold border by default. RDT drops are recognized by item name and quantity dropped. There will be some overlap with other drop tables.

modules.name: Ignore runelite sidebar item value rules
modules.subtitle: This is a hack
modules.description: If you'd like to use the built-in item value rules instead of the item value rules in this filter, disable BOTH this module and the item tiers module above. This is a hack to ignore the built-in item value rules. This filter works based on layering filter rules so we don't exit the filter until this very last module.
